ref: 7416 nivātá1 ʻ sheltered from wind ʼ MBh., n. ʻ place so sheltered, absence of wind, a calm ʼ ŚBr. [~ nirvāta -- 1 ʻ windless ʼ Pañcat., m. ʻ a calm ʼ MBh., Pk. ṇivvāya<-> ʻ windless ʼ. Confusion of ni -- and nir -- was furthered by the existence of nivātá -- 2 (ʻ safe ʼ VS., ʻ impregnable ʼ MBh.: √van, cf. Av. nivāti -- ʻ victory ʼ) and of ávāta<-> ʻ unconquerable ʼ (√van) ~ avātá -- ʻ windless ʼ (J. C. W.). -- vāˊta -- ]
Pa. nivāta -- ʻ sheltered from wind ʼ, ˚aka -- (n.?) ʻ sheltered place ʼ;
S. nivāo adj., ˚āī f. ʻ calm ʼ;
H. nīwā m. ʻ calm ʼ, niwāyā ʻ sultry ʼ, niwāī f. ʻ sultriness ʼ;
Si. navā ʻ rest ʼ, nivā -- täna, nav˚ ʻ place screened from wind, rest house, rest ʼ (in m
ng. ʻ rest ʼ perh. < *nirvāta -- 2 s.v. nírvāyati: altern. < nivāsa -- ).
